raw_comment: It seems as if the views of the 15-24 year olds say the world is getting better with each generation while less 40+ year olds say it is. I wonder as to why Brazil and Indonesia have such opposing views about this topic. This relates to my community because my family always says that times were better back when they were young but they always realize how far the world has truly come in certain aspects but also how much it hasn’t changed. In this graph each country will be at a certain point that’ll depict the percentage of 15-24 y/o’s and 40+ y/o’s view on if the world is getting better with each generation. A headline can be “Do the next generations have more hope for the world?”
ace_sentences: Many 15-24-year-olds say that the world is getting better with each generation.
Less 40+-year-olds say that the world is getting better with each generation.
I wonder why Brazil and Indonesia have opposing views about this topic.
This topic relates to my community.
My family always says that times were better when they were young.
My family also realizes that the world has come far in some aspects.
My family also realizes that the world has not changed much in some aspects.
In the graph, each country is at a point.
The point depicts the percentage of 15-24-year-olds who say that the world is getting better with each generation.
The point also depicts the percentage of 40+-year-olds who say that the world is getting better with each generation.
The headline can be: Do the next generations have more hope for the world?
